start_consent.title: Consent
start_consent.consent_explanation: You will be asked to listen to melodies and write down your thoughts. Your information and texts can be used exclusively for research purposes anonymously and confidentially, without any profit. Results can be published in scientific journals and other outlets in accordance with standard practices in the field.
start_consent.consent_agreement: I consent to my data being collected and used under these conditions.

start_dni.title: Access
start_dni.enter_ID: Please enter your initials and the last three digits of your ID

checkID.title: Access
checkID.question: Is this your first time completing this survey?

newID.title: New ID
newID.text: A participant with your same inicials and digits is already registered in our database. We have created a new one just for you. Please remember it for future use.

form.title: Form
form.education: What is the highest educational level you have completed?
form.training: What level of training do you have in harmony and musical scales?
form.familiarity: How familiar are with the concept of musical modes?

calibration.title: Calibration
calibration.instructions: Put your headphones on, play the audio, and set the volume to a comfortable level.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.instructions_1: You will hear two different melodies.
instructions.instructions_2: While you listen, close your eyes and imagine a specific place with as much detail as you can. What place is it? What is the weather like? What objects are present there? Do you see shapes or colors? Is there anyone around? Who are they and what are they doing? What sounds and aromas do you perceive? How do you feel? Let your imagination flow. There are no right or wrong answers.
instructions.instructions_3: You will then need to write down all these thoughts.

listen.title: Listen
listen.listen_1: Let's begin with the first melody
listen.listen_2: Let's listen to the second melody
listen.instruction: Close your eyes and listen carefully

write.now: Now write down everything that crossed your mind
write.limit: You have a three minute limit
write.emptytext: Do you want to send an empty text?

finalized.title: Finalized
finalized.forget: Now, forget about the first melody and let's move on to the second one.
finalized.move_on: Now, move on to the second room to continue the experience.

totems.title: Totems
totems.identical: It has to be identical to the one used during the experience

totem.title: Totem
totem.click: Click one of the buttons on the left to see the content
totem.enough: We did not register enough words in your texts to perform analyses. You are welcome to participate again. This window will close itself in X seconds.

NaN.subtitle: We identified the key concepts in your text

emotions.title: Emotions
emotions.subtitle: We measured the intensity of the emotions you felt while listening to the melody

image.title: Image
image.subtitle: We captured this image from your mind. Does it match what you imagined?

singularity.title: Singularity
singularity.subtitle: We measured the similarity between your response and everyone else's
singularity.singularity_text_0: Your mind reflects the collective musical consciousness!
singularity.singularity_text_0_25: Your mind is close to the collective musical consciousness!
singularity.singularity_text_0_5: Your musical experience is common and unique at the same time!
singularity.singularity_text_0_75: You experience music in a singular way!
singularity.singularity_text_1: You experience music in a totally unique way!

about_the_mode.title: About the mode
about_the_mode.subtitle: We transcribed the melody that you heard. Play it again and learn more about this mode.

mode.ionian_text_1: Very used in occidental music, in multiple genres.
mode.ionian_text_2: Only Greek major mode with major seventh and natural fourth.
mode.ionian_text_4: It is usually employed to communicate positive emotions.
mode.dorian_text_1: Very common in rock, jazz, funk and pop.
mode.dorian_text_2: Only Greek minor mode with natural sixth.
mode.dorian_text_4: Widely used to communicate positive emotions and playful sensations.
mode.phrygian_text_1: Common in metal and some subgenres of flamenco.
mode.phrygian_text_2: Only Greek minor mode with minor second and natural fifth.
mode.phrygian_text_4: Widely used to communicate negative emotions and to generate tension.
mode.lydian_text_1: Usually employed to create particular climates in rock and film scores.
mode.lydian_text_2: Only Greek major mode with major seventh and augmented fourth.
mode.lydian_text_4: Widely used to communicate positive emotions and dream sensations.
mode.mixolydian_text_1: Common in rock, blues and funk.
mode.mixolydian_text_2: Only major Greek mode with minor seventh.
mode.mixolydian_text_4: Many artists use it to communicate positive emotions.
mode.aeolian_text_1: Common in the West, in genres such as rock, pop, jazz and classical music.
mode.aeolian_text_2: Only minor Greek mode with minor second and minor sixth.
mode.locrian_text_1: It is the least used mode in the world.
mode.locrian_text_2: Only greek mode with minor second and diminished fifth.
mode.locrian_text_4: Harmonically it is very unstable and often evokes discomfort.

songs.title: Songs
songs.subtitle: We compiled songs from different genres that employ this mode.
songs.scan: Scan this QR to listen to the full tracks.

share.title: Share
share.subtitle: We generated a souvenir that you can share on social media.
share.scan: Scan the QR code to access the souvenir
share.download: Download the image on your phone
share.social: Share your souvenir on social media
share.template_text: The music of Mind Melodies triggered these images in my brain

exit.title: Exit
exit.subtitle: Are you sure you want to exit?
exit.automatic_close: This window will close itself in X seconds.

error.title: Error
error.server_trouble: We are having trouble with our servers
error.server_guide: Please let one of our guides know
error.404_ID: It looks like this ID does not exist
